comment: thoroughly enjoyed reading all the books classes were incredibly interesting. writing papers challenging, but rewarding once done

He can be quite rude.  Do not engage in crosstalk with your fellow students.  Do not be late and make sure you are present for every class.  Class was pretty easy.  Timed in-class essay writing could be pretty intense.  Not too bad if you don't mind being talked down to.

Certainly knows his stuff, but condescending and rude to students. Very inappropriate at times, and grades very subjectively. Pick another professor - I wish I had, even with getting an A in the class.

no real text book was needed, we read 4 paper back books instead. If you listen in class, or read the books at home you should do well on the test. Hes serious about attendance, and takes it RIGHT when class starts.
Absolutely terrible professor. Cannot decipher his handwriting, and he grades papers unlike any professor I have had thus far. Do yourself a favor and find a better professor.

Teacher is a pain. If you don't like mandatory reading between each class then this class isnt for you. The tests are 3 parts and essay, identify who said a particular quote and its significance to the book as a whole, and identify the character and their importance. 3 tests 2 papers. Grades hard as hell and makes you feel dumb every time you atten

I do not recommend this professor. I am in the last semester of my Sophmore year and this is the first class I have ever dropped. Books are interesting tests are ok but very hard to finish in the time given. 2 Papers graded very unfairly and if you ask for help he is vague on every aspect of the paper.
Don't bother asking him to help you with papers unless you're doing them way ahead of time.  He does not return emails promptly and feedback on papers until the very next class date.

Took him in the summer.  The class only had three grades (2 exams and one paper).  Exams are two parts: short-answer/terms and quotes and a five paragraph essay.  Don't take him if you struggle writing 5 paragraph essays in under an hour in fall/spring sem., and 2 and a 1/2 hours during the summer.  Go to the writing center instead of emailing him.

Great prof. He's really funny and tries hard to make the material interesting. You don't really need to read if you go to class and take good notes. Tests are short answer and essay format, and there's one short (5-7p) essay.

Great class. Teacher knows his stuff and if you listen to what he has to say you just might learn something too. He's tough but not unreasonable. I found him to be an exceptionally knowledgeable teacher who is not only smart but clever.  If you're looking for a hand-out he is not your man; perhaps you'd be better suited going back to HS.

I loved his class. He's an amazing teacher, and is really funny. Three tests 15% each), two papers (20% each), and participation (15%). Tests are long, but he makes it clear what you need to know for them. Papers are tough but you can submit rough drafts and topic ideas. Participation is attendance and class discussion.

He is an amazing teacher! Yes, you actually have to read the books and WORK for your grades, but that is the point of college after all is it not? He is willing to help proof your papers and will meet with you on them to answer all of your questions. His tests are tough, but if you come to class and participate in lecture they are easy As!

Mr. Norris is awesome!!! We had 6 books to read and he leads discussion on them very well.  He goes over the quotes and characters thoroughly and explains what he wants in his papers really well. There are 2 literary analysis papers, and he tells you what is expected. Great teacher! I plan on taking him again!

Only uses one of the textbooks, attendance is not mandatory, totally unclear on what he wants in our papers, two quizzes that are probably the only easy thing about the class...about 4-5 argumentative papers to write and only a few of them are recorded. I was an A student in my AP Lit class and I got a 600 in writing on the SATs. Got a C.

He handles the classroom poorly.  He was so rude to my classmates that the students had to defend themselves just to use the restroom, checking the time on their watches, etc.  If you happen to be a LGBT individual, do not expect to be included during dialog.  Take Someone Else! He is not that easy and will treat you like a child.

Norris is AWESOME! He has a different kind of humor, so not everybody got him. But if you go to class and do your readings, you will do fine on your tests. He explained multiple times what he expected on his tests and essays and even offered to let students turn in rough drafts early for him to proof before turning in the final copy.

Excellent professor. A bit awkward about touchy subjects, but other wise has a very firm grasp on literature and enjoys explaining it. As long as the student picks a good topic for papers and listens a bit in class this is a very easy class. Highly recommended. (not for lazy people)
Though the books are interesting, and he leads discussion on the literature very well, he is not helpful at all. His grading system is unclear and he is very vague on essay expectations.

I LOVED this teacher! This class is not for people who are bad in English. It was one of my favorite classes at KSU and if you are good at English you will do good in his class. Read, take notes-write the pgs he mentions in class those are usually where the quotes come from. 3 essay tests and 2 papers. GO TO CLASS!

Got a B in his class, but found it extremely boring. You write 2 papers, each of which counts as 20% of  your grade. He makes rude remarks during class and thinks they're funny when really they are gross. NOT recommended.

He could care less about students and the writing topics are so boring and hard to get in to. I had a stomach bug one week and had to miss class and he told me I can't work on papers at home. WTF, that's where most people do their best work, not when they're rushed to get it done in an hour. I hated him, he's cheesy and boring. DO NOT TAKE HIM

We didn't have our books for the first several weeks of class so that made it hard. He is really strict on grammar, and on style; making sure you are writing the style he wants you to write. As long as you do lots of research and go to the writing lab, and turn in rough drafts you might pass it.
Long essay style tests that are hard to finish in time. They can be confusing too. You can feel rushed when taking them.

I am studious but this class was terrible. INCREDIBLY BORING topics that are difficult to feel excited to write about. You will not leave this class excited about writing/english. Hard to tell what he wants from you..unclear direction about your writing. I pity whoever has class with him.

Bad, bad, bad! Horrible handwritting! All he gives you is a letter grade with hardly any notes on the paper so you dont know what to fix next time. completly innapropriate in class and rude to students. boring topics! dont try to go to him for help it will be useless. i do not reccomend him!

This teacher will make your life a living hell!! He could care less about his sturdents and helping them succeed. DOn't go to him for help on anything, The last thing I asked for help on was the final paper which he said if you emalied him he'd review and send you his notes, ALL I got back the words "Got it" with his itiials below it. HE BLOWS!!

Do not take him for English 1102. He may be good for other classes but NOT this one. You have four in class papers analyzing essays you read. Boring topics and his grading is ridiculous! It changes everytime. He'll give more comments on final drafts which isn't helpful at all!! His handwriting sucks so you can't read his comments.

Tests are sort of long. Make sure you take notes on all the quotations he discusses cause they show up on tests. huge 8-10 page paper due at end of semester on Literary Analysis. He sort of speaks slow which gets annoying cause he does some random pauses when speaking. Cool guy though but grading is sort of weird and random. Choose small class

While he is a nice guy in class, his grading his horrid and incomprehensible. It seems that he plays favorites in the class or grades papers differently depending on topic, not on analysis/argument skill. Most of the stuff you will read (and there's a lot of reading) will be a version of romanticism, so get used to it.

Dr. Norris is absolutely AMAZING! take him if you can, you'll have an amazing experience in his class. You have to read the books he assigns to succeed and be serious about his class. He has a great sense of humor and cracks jokes in class. He's a very cool professor and handsome too :). Take him if you can

Dr. Norris is an excellent teacher. Before I took his class, I was a terrible writer. By the time I had finished his class, I had acquired the tools I needed to make an A on every paper I have had in college! He has a great senses of humor. It is hard for stupid people to catch his jokes. I highly recommend Dr. Norris!
Dr. Norris is hilarious and looks like Jeffery Jones in Beetle Juice. His tests require total understanding of the books we read.

You write 3 papers and have several tests.  Pay attention in class.  Has an ego talks about england alot and when he reads an english book he does it with an english accent.  kinda annoying.  Busted my butt in this class and got a C.

Very structured class. Lots of inclass writing, but no outside work. Great if you are already a confident writer...not so great otherwise. Witty fellow, dry sense of humor, wish my class had lightened up more and enjoyed him. Six papers - one gets dropped - and two quizzes. Tough grader but helpful. A class I learned to love.

Didn't really teach much, assignments were unclear and when you question him about them he makes you feel uncomfortable like your "stupid" or something. very narcissitic. talks always about how he has a phd in lit, but he is one of the least street smart people i have ever met. bad jokes, akward in class, paper assignments are long and boring

Fun, enjoyable class.  Dr. Norris is very knowledgable and very funny, a rare combination.  Doesn't use his research background to impress you, only uses it to enhance class discussion.  Highly recommended.
good.  pay attention in class!

enjoyed the assigned reading but enjoyed the class discussion even more.  prof has good sense of humor.  2 essays - somewhat hard, 3 tests - moderately hard.  go to class, read and should get A, B at least.
Great guy, easy to understand what he's looking for but grades very hard. No outside work at all

Says lots of witty jokes and his class is easy. There is almost no outside work. Class was 2 really easy quizzes and 6 papers  with 1 being dropped. He gives lots of feedback and tells you what he wants. If you actually go to class and work while you are in class there is no way you wont get a good grade. If you cant, you wont make it in college.

Recently decorated Doctorate of Medieval English.  Before taking this course, know what a literary analysis is, then learn what he wants in a literary analysis.  He tries to be funny at the expense of others, which shows signs of his insecurity.  Lots of reading!!!!

His tests are very demanding as far as information goes and takes up the full amount of time. You may even need more time, which is not allowed. Does have papers. Doesn't take roll, but mentally takes note of who is there.Tries to be funny, but usually ends up offending someone.Does bring up himself a bit, which makes him seem insecure, but ok prof

You have to write papers in class only, but he checks a rough draft for you. If you go to him he is very helpful. 15% of your grade is attendance so go to class. I really learned how to write papers! I made an "A" and was suprised at how well my writing developed.
All youdo is write a few three page papers in class.  NO HOMEWORK!!
Good teacher. Spent classes writing your essays and revising them and going over the material for the essays. No work outside of class. Good guy made class funny.

very nice guy.jokes around alot and has a sarcastic sense of humor. i usually hate english but he made it ok.  there are 2 quizzes & 6 papers all done in class, none outside of class.  there are no books to read, just a packet with different bits and pieces pulled from random stories. if you dont like reading this guy is for you!

Dr. Norris was the first B that I ever got in college. His tests were really long- too much to complete in one class period. I went to him to help me on both of the papers he assigned and both times, even though I corrected the paper the way he asked, I still didn't do very well- on the second paper I went to the Writing Center and still got a B-.

Doesn't give much work to do unless you like writing 7 pages of literary analysis to turn in. Very boring class discussions. He takes to long to discuss a piece of literature so we didn't even get to read all of the books we bought for this class. Not my favorite, I used to enjoy reading.

Nice guy who really enjoys what he does.  I wish Kennesaw would bloody hire him... 2 papers (plus one optional).  Not very clear on what to do in papers, but is delighted to read all the drafts you can hand him.  Tests consists of quotes, character identification, and essays, and are not too hard if you do the reading.  Plan to read 6+ hours/wk.

Has two literary analysis papers. Multiple tests that included quotes, essay, and identification. A lot of reading in the class. A large portion of grade is participate in class discussions. Hardly gives pop quizzes.

He was a very good teacher.He is funny and friendly and helpful! He will look at your papers ahead of time and then help you with any improvements on them.There are only 2 papers.Class discussions are interesting and the tests arent too hard either.Tests are short answer, quotes, and in class essay.
